title.narrative: EQUITABLE ACCESS

description.narrative: Education stakeholders at national and sub-national level have increased capacity to implement at scale sustainable programmes to improve equitable access for the most disadvantaged children, especially girls., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EDUCATION outcome: Girls and boys of school age especially vulnerable children in deprived provinces and areas, access primary education that is progressively child friendly and demonstrates improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education stakeholders at national and sub-national level have increased capacity to implement at scale sustainable programmes toimprove equitable access for the most disadvantaged children, especially girls.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to support interventionsaimed to improve equitable access for the most disadvantaged children, especially girls, through providing Community Based Education (CBE) with access to learning opportunities. As a result.238,123 students (124,554 girls and 113,569 boys) received quality learning opportunitiesthrough 7,604 CBE classes across 20provinces. Out of this number, 680 CBE classes are in the areas in the South where children did not have access to primary (formal) education for the past two decades. Further, UNICEF supported 1,099,000 children with teaching and learning supplies | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:12/01/2022
